title: The courteous carman, and the amorous maid. Or, the carman's whistle. What here is pen'd in this same pleasant story, doth only tend unto the carmans glory; who did relieve a maiden in distress, and brought her joy in midst of heaviness: he was couragious, and of mettle good, as by this story may be nnderstood [sic]. To a new tune, called, The carmans whistle; or, Lord Willoughby's march, &c.
publisher: Printed for F[rancis]. Coles, T[homas]. Vere, J[ohn]. Wright, J[ohn]. Clarke, W[illiam]. Thackeray, & T[homas]. Passinger.,
